title: Head from a Tomb Statue of a Man
description:
Painted limestone head of a man wearing curled wig, ears not indicated. Fine quality conventionalized face painted orange-red. Remains of black paint on wig. Eyes originally inlaid. Preserved to base of neck.
Condition: Poor. In gouging out the eyes all adjacent areas were badly damaged.
credit_line: Gift of the Ernest Erickson Foundation, Inc.

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 86.226.1
labels.content: A tomb statue provided an eternal image for the deceased’s spirit to inhabit, in order to receive the offerings needed in the afterlife. Ancient tomb robbers roughly gouged out the valuable inlaid eyes of copper and stone that would have given this statue a lifelike appearance.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
